page.title: 07ALL SAINT'S CHURCH
page.content: The church, next to what was the village green,is a very interesting piece of{local history.}The present {building}dates from around the 14th century and was once the site of a famous{Rood or Cross.}Pilgrims used to travel from all over to see this, and it was supposed to have certain special qualities.In 1532, a group of four men from Suffolk entered the church and took the Cross onto the green where they proceeded to set fire to it.This was seen as such a terrible crime that three of the men were caught and within six months all had been hung. One of the three, Roger Marsh was hung on the green itself. Unfortunately there are no stories about his{ghost}returning to the scene. Today the church is the centre of the{Church of England}ministry in the Harwich area.
